result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott M Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DE will pay $25.00 per month commencing 9-1-2015 until paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott M Brooks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Has indicated does not intend to seek PCR

Defendant Scott M Brooks in court with attorney William Frederick Laman.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement has been reached in this matter.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Court will order a fine of $50.00 and CC.  DE will have a payment plan of $25.00 per month commencing 9-01-15 until paid in full.

Defendant Scott M Brooks in court with attorney William Frederick Laman.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set for JT.  State will withdraw all plea offers.  Set for 8-06-15.  JS will begin at 8:30AM, counsel in chambers at 8:00AM.  Motions/final PTC will be heard 7-21-15 @ 1:00PM.
filed by Atty Laman, with attached cover letter dated 5/06/15 from William Laman Law Office
No contact with Michael Soltis or Angela Brooks, with the exception of arrangements for the children, all contact will remain non abusive.

Defendant Scott M Brooks in court with Attorney William Laman.   James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Waive formal reading of the Criminal Complaint, enter a plea of NG to misdemeanor counts.  $500.00 sign bond, no contact with Michael Soltis or Angela Brooks, with the exception of arrangements for the children, all contact will remain non abusive.  Set for RH 6-09-15 @ 4:00PM.
